text:
Hi! In a doble loop, is it possible to get the loop index without doing something like this:
```k = 1
for i in 1:3, j in 1:4
   # do something with i, j and k
   k += 1
end```
?

elements.text: Hi! In a doble loop, is it possible to get the loop index without doing something like this:

k = 1
for i in 1:3, j in 1:4
   # do something with i, j and k
   k += 1
end

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

That does not look too bad to me. Perhaps consider something like

```julia> for (k, (i,j)) in Iterators.enumerate( Iterators.product(1:3, 1:4) )
           println("$k: ($i,$j)")
       end
1: (1,1)
2: (2,1)
3: (3,1)
4: (1,2)
5: (2,2)
6: (3,2)
7: (1,3)
8: (2,3)
9: (3,3)
10: (1,4)
11: (2,4)
12: (3,4)```

elements.text: That does not look too bad to me. Perhaps consider something like

text:
Oops, I changed your iteration order.

```julia> for (k, (j,i)) in Iterators.enumerate( Iterators.product(1:4, 1:3) )
           println("$k: ($i,$j)")
       end
1: (1,1)
2: (1,2)
3: (1,3)
4: (1,4)
5: (2,1)
6: (2,2)
7: (2,3)
8: (2,4)
9: (3,1)
10: (3,2)
11: (3,3)
12: (3,4)```

elements.text: Oops, I changed your iteration order.

text: no problem! I just wanted an example like the one you  provided. Thanks again!

elements.text: no problem! I just wanted an example like the one you  provided. Thanks again!

text:
If `i,j` is for indexing, you may also want to consider,

```julia> for (i,c) in Iterators.enumerate( CartesianIndices((3,4)) )
           println("$i: $c")
       end
1: CartesianIndex(1, 1)
2: CartesianIndex(2, 1)
3: CartesianIndex(3, 1)
4: CartesianIndex(1, 2)
5: CartesianIndex(2, 2)
6: CartesianIndex(3, 2)
7: CartesianIndex(1, 3)
8: CartesianIndex(2, 3)
9: CartesianIndex(3, 3)
10: CartesianIndex(1, 4)
11: CartesianIndex(2, 4)
12: CartesianIndex(3, 4)```

elements.text: is for indexing, you may also want to consider,

julia> for (i,c) in Iterators.enumerate( CartesianIndices((3,4)) )
           println("$i: $c")
       end
1: CartesianIndex(1, 1)
2: CartesianIndex(2, 1)
3: CartesianIndex(3, 1)
4: CartesianIndex(1, 2)
5: CartesianIndex(2, 2)
6: CartesianIndex(3, 2)
7: CartesianIndex(1, 3)
8: CartesianIndex(2, 3)
9: CartesianIndex(3, 3)
10: CartesianIndex(1, 4)
11: CartesianIndex(2, 4)
12: CartesianIndex(3, 4)

text:
```julia> A = reshape(1:12, 3, 4)
3×4 reshape(::UnitRange{Int64}, 3, 4) with eltype Int64:
 1  4  7  10
 2  5  8  11
 3  6  9  12

julia> for (i,c) in Iterators.enumerate( CartesianIndices((3,4)) )
           println(A[i] == A[c])
       end
true
true
true
true
true
true
true
true
true
true
true
true```
